casebody.data:
Morris
v.
Scenera Research, LLC, et al 429PA13-1 Supreme Court of North Carolina. June 30, 2016 John M. Moye, Attorney at Law, Adam H. Charnes, Attorney at Law, Winston-Salem, Burley B. Mitchell, Jr., Attorney at Law, Richard D. Dietz, Attorney at Law, Catharine B. Arrowood, Attorney at Law, Scott E. Bayzle, Attorney at Law, Catherine R.L. Lawson, Attorney at Law, Raleigh, for Scenera Research, LLC, et al. Walter E. Brock, Jr., Attorney at Law, Andrew P. Flynt, Attorney at Law, Raleigh, Patrick M. Aul, Attorney at Law, Charlotte, for Morris, Robert Paul. Richard A. Coughlin, Attorney at Law, Greensboro, for N.C. Chamber and N.C. Assoc. of Defense Attorneys. Matthew Nis Leerberg, Attorney at Law, Raleigh, for N.C. State University. John R. Wester, Attorney at Law, Charlotte, Gary A. Bornstein, Attorney at Law, Thomas Holderness, Attorney at Law, Charlotte, for Qualcomm Incorporated, et al.

The following order has been entered on the motion filed on the 22nd of June 20 16 by Plaintiff in the Alternative to Issue a Mandate Remanding this Motion to the Trial Court for Further Proceedings:

"Motion Allowed by order of the Court in conference, this the 30th of June 2016."
